Summary Note:
The RM was introduced to Schneider Graf Egger at a corporate retreat in Vienna. They participated in team-building activities and developed a strong rapport, which eventually led to a successful business partnership.
Schneider Graf Egger is a 41 year old Art Advisor from Austria. He has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
Looking for a private bank with a deep understanding of wealth management, he joined Julius Baer for its expertise.
Family Background: Schneider Graf Egger is married to Sophia. Together they have 3 kids called Kr√§mer, Lea and Gertrud.
Education Background:
Schneider received his secondary school diploma from Theresianum in 2002.
After that, he went on to study at Mozarteum University Salzburg until 2008.
Occupation History:
Schneider Graf Egger is a seasoned professional with over 18 years of experience.
In 2007, Schneider Graf Egger started working as a Art Dealer at Belvedere Museum, marking the beginning of his successful career.
His subsequent role was as a Gallery Owner at MUMOK, where he continued to grow professionally from 2010 to 2015.
At Kunsthistorisches Museum, he worked as a Art Advisor from 2015 till now, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
Wealth Summary:
Throughout his career, he saved 210000 EUR, investing in various assets to grow his wealth.
He owns townhouse in Amstetten, where he resides. It is worth 861000 EUR.

He purchased condo in Steinbach am Attersee, where he spends his holidays. It is valued at 1019000 EUR.

In addition to his career success, he also received an inheritance of 1470000 EUR from his late grandmother, a renowned Stock Trader, in 2005.
Client Summary: In summary, Schneider has demonstrated a strong work ethic and financial acumen, positioning them well for the future.
